format: A data frame with 8 observations on the following 6 variables.

parameters.num_control: the number of students in the school in the control group
parameters.num_treat: the number of students in the school receiving the treatment
parameters.se: the standard error of the effect estimate

reference: Data copy-pasted from Table 1 in Rubin (1981).
description:
Description
You've all seen these before. These are the "eight schools" that everyone gets when
being introduced to Bayesian programming. Here are the full data for your consideration,
which you can use instead of awkwardly searching where the data are and copy-pasting
them as a list. Every damn time, Steve.
title: The Effect of Special Preparation on SAT-V Scores in Eight Randomized Experiments
